definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: Lying within the South Temperate Zone, New Zealand has an oceanic climate, without extremes of heat or cold.
sentences.chinese: 新西兰地处南温带，属海洋性气候，没有严冬和酷署。

sentences.english: Is the tropics marine climate, year to year high temperature moist rain.
sentences.chinese: 属热带海洋性气候，常年高温潮湿多雨。

sentences.english: This area is belong to oceanic-continental transitional climate , has different scene in each season.
sentences.chinese: 景区属北温带大陆海洋性气候，四季皆可一游。

sentences.english: Therefore, said Mira Hill is a continental climate with the climate of the watershed.
sentences.chinese: 因此说，米拉山是大陆性气候与海洋性气候的分水岭。

sentences.english: The Pacific northwest is favored with a maritime climate.
sentences.chinese: 太平洋西北岸为海洋性气候。

sentences.chinese: 因此说，米拉山是大陆性气候与海洋性气候的分水岭。

sentences.english: Li I'm not used to this maritime climate yet.
sentences.chinese: 我到现在还不习惯这里的海洋性气候。

sentences.english: You're my temperate maritime climate being warm all the time.
sentences.chinese: 你是我的温带海洋性气候一直都是暖暖的。

sentences.english: The southwestern coastal region has a humid mild marine climate.
sentences.chinese: 西南海岸地区有着潮湿温和的海洋性气候。

sentences.english: You are my temperate marine climate, has always been warm.
sentences.chinese: 你是我的温带海洋性气候，一直都是暖暖的。
